column4: I'm using Ubuntu 11.10, why is the Update Manager trying to send me plugins for Gwibber when I don't have it installed???
Did you remove or purge it?
I think I uninstalled it via the Software Center.
When you uninstall through the Software Center it simply removes the core program, but many extra settings (profile data, logs, preferences, etc.) still remain.
If it says it's not installed just "sudo apt-get install gwibber && sudo apt-get purge gwibber". Anyway, after the purge runs fine, just "sudo apt-get update" and check the updates again
i just had a similar issue with removing deluge
Hmm... One sec. I don't use Gwibber anyway so I'll try to delete and reproduce it.
I'm not being asked for upgrades. But then, it may have been fully upgraded anyway. Run "sudo apt-get upgrade" and what package names are in "The following packages will be upgraded:"?
it's also trying to install evolution.  I uninstalled evolution when I had 11.04.

evolution evolution-common evolution-plugins gconf-defaults-service gconf2 gconf2-common gir1.2-gconf-2.0 gnome-settings-daemon gwibber-service-facebook gwibber-service-identica gwibber-service-twitter indicator-session libevolution

Person had the same problem here: http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/ubuntu-63/11-10-with-ubuntu1-and-gwibber-removed-still-getting-gwibber-updates-912325/ The fix was "sudo apt-get purge "gwibber.*""
As for Evolution, I'd suggest something similar. "sudo apt-get purge evolution "evolution.*" "evolution-*"" should be overkill but fix it. :)
thanks man, i'm off to bed
